title: Kęstutis Ruzgys
text:
Kęstutis Ruzgys (born 15 September 1962) is a retired <a href="Lithuania">Lithuania</a>n <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a> who played in Soviet Union, Baltic states, Yugoslavia and Germany during his professional career.
Ruzgys was born in <a href="Klaip%C4%97da">Klaipėda</a>. He played with <a href="FK%20%C5%BDalgiris%20Vilnius">FK Žalgiris Vilnius</a> in the <a href="Soviet%20First%20League">Soviet First League</a> in addition to <a href="OFK%20Beograd">OFK Beograd</a> in the <a href="Yugoslav%20First%20League">Yugoslav First League</a>. He won a total of three caps for the <a href="Lithuania%20national%20football%20team">Lithuanian national team</a>, scoring no goals, while playing in <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a> as a professional for OFK Beograd. He ended his career playing in Germany with <a href="Sportfreunde%20Siegen">Sportfreunde Siegen</a>.
His son, Manfredas Ruzgys, born in 1997, is also a footballer, and debuted for <a href="Lithuania%20national%20football%20team">Lithuania</a> in 2016 at age of 19.
